entry.title: Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs lawyer urges action from Armenian government

media:group.media:title: Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs lawyer urges action from Armenian government
media:group.media:description:
üìç Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan says the necessary infrastructure is in place for Azerbaijani vehicles to transit through Armenian territory and can be opened within weeks, but only on a reciprocal basis. üìç Ruben Vardanyan‚Äôs lawyer Jared Genser has called on Armenian authorities to take stronger action to secure his release and that of other ‚ÄúArmenian Christian political prisoners‚Äù held in Baku. üìç CivilNet Podcast: The Trump-Zelenskyy showdown and what it means for Armenia- https://youtu.be/Ia3Ie-J5T58

entry.title: The Trump-Zelenskyy showdown and what it means for Armenia

media:group.media:title: The Trump-Zelenskyy showdown and what it means for Armenia
media:group.media:description:
In this episode of the CivilNet podcast, political analyst Eric Hacopian breaks down the geopolitical shockwaves following the explosive meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He explains the Trump administration‚Äôs foreign policy approach behind the drama, what it will mean for Europe and the NATO alliance, and how Armenia can navigate this unpredictable moment.

entry.title: Russian border guards withdraw from Armenia-Turkey checkpoint

media:group.media:title: Russian border guards withdraw from Armenia-Turkey checkpoint
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: Armenia approves first-of-its-kind law on cryptocurrency regulation: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia approves first-of-its-kind law on cryptocurrency regulation: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs banks together posted nearly $923 million in profit last year, according to the head of the Union of Banks, a sign the country‚Äôs banking sector remains one of the main beneficiaries of the regional economic knock-on effects of Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine. üìç Meanwhile, turnover in Armenia‚Äôs burgeoning tech sector topped $2.3 billion last year. üìç The Armenian government decided to grant $150 million loan guarantees to Lydian International, the U.S.-Canadian operator of the long-stalled Amulsar gold mine project. üìç The government also approved a first-of-its-kind law regulating cryptocurrencies. üìç A step-by-step guide to Armenia‚Äôs new income declaration system: https://shorturl.at/w83Et
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: "Ruben Vardanyan needs to be healthy for us"- hunger strike in Freedom Square

media:group.media:title: "Ruben Vardanyan needs to be healthy for us"- hunger strike in Freedom Square
media:group.media:description:
For 13 days now, former State Minister of Artsakh, businessman and philanthropist Ruben Vardanyan has been on hunger strike in a Baku prison. To support him and other Armenians held captive in Baku, Mane Tandilyan, co-founder of the "Country to Live" party, along with citizens Vardan Avagyan and Artavazd Alaverdyan, declared their own hunger strike in Yerevan now on its third day. "The meaning of this hunger strike is for Vardanyan to know that we are waiting for him here, we need him healthy. This is our shame that he is forced to go through all this. It means that we have done nothing, especially the government," Mane Tandilyan told CivilNet.
